content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 8600.4 - Procedure

State Regulations
(a) The master
application procedure shall be initiated at the option of the
applicant. (b) Master application
project information form shall be supplied by the office. It shall be
sufficiently comprehensive to allow any State agency having a possible interest
in the business undertaking, project or activity to make an informed
determination whether a permit may be, is, or is not required. (c) The office, upon request, may assist an
applicant in filling out the master application project information
form. (d) Upon receipt of a
completed master application project information form, the office shall send a
copy of the form to every State permitting agency it believes to have a
possible interest in the business undertaking. (e) Each State agency receiving a master
application project information form shall respond in writing within 15 working
days of receipt of the application, with the following information and
materials: (1)
a listing of any permits under
its jurisdiction which may be required for the business undertaking, project or
activity, the application forms for such permits, a statement of what fees may
be required for those permits; or
(2)
that no permits are required. (f) A State agency that responds
that it has no interest in a master application project information form, or
that fails to respond within 15 working days shall not require any permit for
the business undertaking project or activity. (g) No State agency shall be barred from
requiring any permit for a business undertaking, project or activity where the
office determines that: (1)
the information
on the master application project information form was false, misleading, or
materially incomplete; (2)
in that
situation a reasonable judgment of the agency's interest was impracticable; or
(3)
new permit requirements or
related standards subsequently have become effective and the agency had no
discretion in establishing the effective date. (h) After responses are received from the
agencies, the office shall: (1)
provide the
applicant with all application forms and related information for those permits
which the interested agencies have indicated may be required; and
(2)
advise the applicant to complete the
application forms and return them with all necessary fees and information
either to the office or directly to the agencies. (i) A master application project information
form may be withdrawn at any time by the applicant without prejudice to any
permit approvals pending or obtained pursuant to the master application
procedure. Notes
